Nodon hunters are level 92 Slayer creatures found at the Nodon Front in Senntisten.

When a Nodon enforcer appears occasionally after a Nodon engineer is killed, they can be accompanied by a variant of a hunter named Henchman, Nodon hunter. Henchmen are identical to the hunters in stats and appearance, but cannot use the special attack.

Two of them also occasionally attack Kree'arra or Nex's praesul, who promptly dispatch them.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Nodon Front120None8Maplink

Strategy[edit | edit source]

Nodon hunters fight using ranged attacks. After 6 auto-attacks, they will execute a special attack where they say BOMBS AWAY!, after which they will rain arrows in a 3x3 area surrounding your current position. The arrows emit toxic fumes that deal damage over time, signified by a message in the chatbox that reads Your lungs fill from the toxic gases.. The damage can be negated by moving away from your position right as the hunter calls for the bombardment. Damage from the special attack is reduced if the player is wearing any headgear item that works as a face mask (such as a Slayer helmet).

  6. ^ Only obtainable once the Pontifex shadow ring has been upgraded to tier 5 or higher. Replaces the T2 Trove.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • update 1 November 2021 (Update):
    • Increased the amount of anima the player gains from killing creatures within Senntisten.
    • Having the ring upgraded will now continue to drop anima at a 100% drop rate rather than the previous 1/6 chance.
  • hidden 27 September 2021 (Update):
    • More Nodon dragonkin and siege engines have been added to the area to the west of the Cathedral, including additional 4 hunter spawns.
  • hotfix 27 July 2021:
    • Loot from Nodon will no longer drop under siege engines (causing loot to be unobtainable in specific cases).[3]
  • update 26 July 2021 (Update):
    • Added to game.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Luma's Twitter account. 27 July 2021. (Archived from the original on 27 July 2021.) Mod Luma: "Naressa's journal now has a much lower (higher? it's easier to get now anyways 🙂) drop rate, with a guaranteed drop if you have over 1.6k kills"
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Luma's Twitter account. 27 July 2021. (Archived from the original on 27 July 2021.) Mod Luma: "can you confirm that the lorehound increases the book chance?" Mod Luma: "confirmed"
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Luma's Twitter account. 27 July 2021. (Archived from the original on 27 July 2021.) Mod Luma: "Loot from Nodon will no longer drop under siege engines (causing loot to be unobtainable in specific cases)"
